availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Burton (Carter County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. )

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Virginia native. Married to Lucretia Osburn Burton. Father of Caleb Burton, James Burton, Juda Burton, Hulda Burton, Nancy Burton, Mary Burton, Eliza Burton, David Burton, Caroline Burton, John Burton, and Helen Burton. Married to Margaret Osburn Burton in Carter County on April 12, 1860. Father of Owen Burton, Lucretia Burton, and Prudy Burton. Resident of Russell County, Virginia, in 1840. Farmer in Carter County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Carter County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Virginia, Russell County, City/District, p. 34.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District No 2, p. 245A-245-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 187.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Precinct No 2, p. 105B-106A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Carter County Marriages, Film 001759301.
"Isaac Osbin Burton (1807-1884)," Find A Grave, Memorial 65836961, accessed September 14, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65836961.
